name: crisply
content:
crisply adverb
(STIFF AND SMOOTH)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is stiff and smooth: He always wore crisply pressed trousers. The flag was crisply folded and put away.
More examplesFewer examplesHis white shirt was crisply ironed.Fold the paper crisply, avoiding unnecessary doubling. Crisply tailored, Minogue headed off to a London radio interview.

crisply adverb
(CLEAR)
in a way that gives a very clear image or sound: The presenter must stay crisply in focus in the foreground of the shot. Every word came out crisply through the sound system.
More examplesFewer examplesThe picture is crisply focused, with good, vibrant colours.It is a crisply shot, but otherwise unremarkable, film.Traditional TVs can show HDTV programming, but sometimes not as crisply as LCD TVs.
